definitions.definition: used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a group of people or things previously mentioned as the subject of the clause.
examples: countries unable to look after themselves

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a particular group of people or things mentioned.
examples: excellent at organizing others, they may well be disorganized themselves

definitions.definition: used instead of “himself” or “herself” to refer to a person of unspecified sex.
examples: anyone who fancies themselves as a racing driver
